definition: to issue a call for action/to raise one's hand and issue a rousing call (idiom)
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself
arm
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale

sentences.english: Flap arm a shout who have no should, on smiling a sword blood to seal a larynx, the west delivers big gun.
sentences.chinese: 振臂一呼誰無應，一笑間劍血封喉，西邊送來了大炮。

definition: to make a clarion call/to make a public appeal
a hundred answers to a single call (idiom)/to respond en masse
to give one's allegiance/(popular) support
the whole country in rebellion
hero/towering figure
to change sides in a war/turncoat
to rebel/to revolt
outstanding heroes/warlords vying for supremacy (in former times)/stars (of sports or pop music)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to suppress by armed force/to send a punitive expedition against/to crusade against
to endorse/to support
to respond instantly/to act at once on hearing the news
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
to console the people by punishing the tyrants (idiom)
that which is yearned for by the public
